edu.cpp.cs.cs141.classproject

Class UI

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.cpp.cs.cs141.classproject.UI

  • public class UI
extends java.lang.Object
    The UI class represents the interface through which the player will interact with the game world. It exists as an object within the GameEngine, and is queried whenever input/output to the player is needed. The class is able to pass any necessary input from the player to interact with their Player character.
    Author:
    Natanael Ariawan, David Hau, Miguel Menjivar, Aidan Novobilski

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  UI.action
      This field represents all possible actions that a player can take on a turn.
      static class  UI.direction
      This field represents all possible directions that a player could possibly input.
      static class  UI.mode
      This field represents all possible modes that the player can input.

    • Field Detail

      • sc

        private java.util.Scanner sc
        This field represents the Scanner object that will read all player input into the console. It is initialized during the constructor and used whenever the player's input is needed.

      • input

        private java.lang.String input
        This field represents the stored input of the player. Initialized within any method that reads input, since String is immutable.

    • Constructor Detail

      • UI

        public UI()
        The default constructor. Initializes the Scanner object.

    • Method Detail

      • printTitle

        public void printTitle()
        This method prints the "title screen" of the game.

      • mainMenu

        public java.lang.String mainMenu(Highscore[] highscores,
                                 boolean[] achievements,
                                 int[] records)
        This method directs the player to the main menu, which has a variety of options, including new game, load game, how to play, and other extraneous functions.
        Parameters:
        highscores - the array of highscores taken from the GameEngine to be sent to printHighscores(Highscore[]) if the player wishes to view the highscores page
        achievements - the array of achievements taken from the GameEngine to be sent to printAchievements(boolean[]) if the player wishes to view the achievements page
        records - the array of records taken from the GameEngine to be sent to printRecords(int[]) if the player wishes to view the records page
        Returns:
        a string indicating an action needed to be completed within the GameEngine

      • selectMode

        public UI.mode selectMode(boolean godMode)
        This method will ask the player the game mode they would like to play in and returns the type of game mode they selected. If God mode has been bought from the Shop, an extra option appears allowing the player to select God mode.
        Parameters:
        godMode - true if God mode has been bought from the Shop, false otherwise
        Returns:
        one of the five possible game mode options listed in the enumeration UI.mode

      • printRules

        public void printRules()
        This method will print the rules of the game.

      • printShop

        public Shop.upgrades printShop(int money,
                               int vision,
                               int magazine,
                               int health,
                               int visionCost,
                               int magazineCost,
                               int healthCost,
                               boolean godMode)
        This method prints the shop according to the parameters taken from the Shop through the GameEngine.
        Parameters:
        money - the amount of money the player currently has
        vision - the player's current vision upgrade level
        magazine - the player's current magazine upgrade level
        health - the player's current health magazine upgrade level
        visionCost - the cost to buy the next vision upgrade
        magazineCost - the cost to buy the next magazine upgrade
        healthCost - the cost to buy the next health upgrade
        godMode - true if the player has obtained God mode, false otherwise
        Returns:
        the type of upgrade bought, if any, in order to be acted upon in the GameEngine

      • printHighscores

        public void printHighscores(Highscore[] highscores)
        This method prints the list of highscores and corresponding names based on the highscore array parameter passed from the GameEngine.
        Parameters:
        highscores - the list of highscores to be printed

      • printAchievements

        public void printAchievements(boolean[] achievements)
        This method prints the player's achievements, using the boolean array of achievements passed from the GameEngine as a guideline of which achievements have been obtained.
        Parameters:
        achievements - an array of booleans that represents whether each achievement in the list of achievements has or has not been obtained

      • printRecords

        public void printRecords(int[] records)
        This method prints all of the player's records based on the array of integers corresponding to each record sent as an array to this method.
        Parameters:
        records - an array of ints that represent each player record noted in the Record class

      • printStats

        public void printStats(int level,
                       int lives,
                       int ammo,
                       int maxAmmo)
        This method prints the player's status corresponding to the current situation using the parameters given.
        Parameters:
        level - the level the player is currently on
        lives - the player's current lives
        ammo - the player's current ammo
        maxAmmo - the max ammo the player can have

      • printMap

        public void printMap(Entity[][] entities)
        This method will draw the map within the console. The player character will be represented with "@", blank space will be represented with ".", and the rooms will be represented with "R". If debug mode is enabled, the game will also show the location of the ninjas with "N" and the briefcase with "B" and powerups with various symbols (b, i, and r). The entire map will be surrounded with walls represented by "#".
        Parameters:
        entities - the map of entities

      • printLegend

        public void printLegend(boolean debug)
        This method will inform the player what the characters on the map stand for.
        Parameters:
        debug - true if the game is in debug mode, false otherwise

      • readAction

        public UI.action readAction(boolean looked,
                            boolean hasBullet)
        This method will query the player for input on what action they wish to take. It will then interpret their input and return one of the five possible action types listed in the UI.action enumeration. If their input is invalid, a proper message will be printed and the player will be queried again.
        Parameters:
        looked - true if the player has already looked this turn, false otherwise
        hasBullet - true if the player still has ammo, false otherwise
        Returns:
        one of five possible action types listed in the UI.action enumeration

      • printLookResults

        public void printLookResults(int ninjaDistance)
        This method will print the results of looking based on the parameter passed. If a ninja was found within the limits of the player's vision in the direction that the player looked, then a value greater than 0 will be passed as the parameter to indicate the distance between the ninja and the player, in which case a proper message will be printed. On the other hand, if the player looks and the first thing that's found is a room or a wall or if the player cannot see anything within their vision limits, then 0 will be passed as the parameter to indicate that nothing was found from looking, in which case a proper message will be printed.
        Parameters:
        ninjaDistance - an int that represents the distance between the closest ninja within the vision limitations and line of sight to the player

      • readDirection

        public UI.direction readDirection()
        This method will query the player for input on what direction they wish to act towards. It will interpret their input and return one of the four cardinal directions. If their input is invalid, a proper message will be printed and the player will be queried again.
        Returns:
        Returns UP, DOWN, LEFT, or RIGHT.

      • printPlayerBumped

        public void printPlayerBumped()
        This method will tell the player that they could not move because they collided with something.

      • printPlayerBumpedWall

        public void printPlayerBumpedWall()
        This method will tell the player that they could not move because they attempted to move into a wall.

      • printCheckedRoom

        public void printCheckedRoom()
        This method will tell the player that they have checked a room and found nothing. For the successful room check, use printVictory().

      • printPowerUp

        public void printPowerUp(Item.itemType type,
                         boolean hasBullet)
        This method will inform the player that they have just picked up an item. In addition, it will take the type of the item as a parameter to tell the player which item was picked up and what resulted from the item.
        Parameters:
        type - the type of the power up that the player picked up
        hasBullet - true if the player has a full magazine, false otherwise

      • printInvincibility

        public void printInvincibility(int turns)
        This method will print all messages regarding invincibility after each turn passes by while the player still has invincibility.
        Parameters:
        turns - an int that represents the number of turns the player has left with invincibility

      • printPlayerDied

        public void printPlayerDied(int lives)
        This method will inform the player that they were killed by a ninja. In addition, it will tell them how many lives they have remaining.
        Parameters:
        lives - the number of lives the player has remaining

      • printShoot

        public void printShoot(boolean hit)
        This method will tell the player whether or not their shot successfully hit an enemy.
        Parameters:
        hit - true if the shot hit, false otherwise

      • printVictory

        public void printVictory()
        This method will inform the player that they have successfully found the briefcase and print the map showing the locations of all ninjas and power ups.

      • printNextLevel

        public boolean printNextLevel()
        This method will ask the player if they want to move onto the next level and return the player's answer as a boolean.
        Returns:
        true if the player chooses to move onto the next level, false otherwise

      • printLoss

        public void printLoss()
        This method will inform the player that they were killed by a ninja and have lost their final life.

      • printLevelClear

        public void printLevelClear(int turnsScore,
                            int livesScore,
                            int roomsScore,
                            int itemsScore,
                            int killsScore,
                            int levelScore)
        This method prints out the level clear screen, which shows the scores given for each criteria and the total score given for clearing the level.
        Parameters:
        turnsScore - the score given based on the number of turns it took to complete the level
        livesScore - the score given based on the number of lives the player has remaining
        roomsScore - the score given based on the number of rooms the player checked
        itemsScore - the score given based on the number of items the player picked up
        killsScore - the score given based on the number of kills the player obtained
        levelScore - the total score given for the level

      • printGameOver

        public void printGameOver(int level,
                          int numOfTurns,
                          int livesRemaining,
                          int roomsChecked,
                          int itemPickups,
                          int enemiesKilled,
                          int score,
                          java.lang.String[] achievements)
        This method prints the game over screen, which shows a number of stats accumulated throughout the single gameplay, the final score obtained in that gameplay, and the achievements that were unlocked from completing that gameplay.
        Parameters:
        level - the highest level achieved during the gameplay
        numOfTurns - the number of turns survived during the gameplay
        livesRemaining - the number of lives remaining during the gameplay
        roomsChecked - the number of rooms checked during the gameplay
        itemPickups - the number of items picked up during the gameplay
        enemiesKilled - the number of enemies killed during the gameplay
        score - the final score of the gameplay
        achievements - an array of strings containing the list of achievements that were unlocked

      • askName

        public java.lang.String askName()
        This method prompts the user to enter their name in order to be entered into the highscore system.
        Returns:
        the String correlating to the player's name

      • printNoHighscore

        public void printNoHighscore()
        This method prints the proper message that the player's score will not be saved, nor recorded, if they are playing in God mode.

      • printReset

        public java.lang.String printReset()
        This method prints a series of messages prompting the player whether or not they would like to reset the status of the game and returns a proper string value when the player wishes to reset the game.
        Returns:
        a string of either "reset" to indicate that the player wishes to reset the game, or null if the player does not want to reset the game

      • printCheat

        public java.lang.String printCheat(boolean cheat)
        This method prompts the user to enter any arbitrary string. If the string is the correct string corresponding to a correct cheat code, then this method will return a proper string value.
        Parameters:
        cheat - true if the player has already entered in a cheat code (checked in the Achievements through the GameEngine), false otherwise
        Returns:
        a string of either "cheat" to indicate a proper cheat code has been entered, or null if the string entered does not match any of the cheat codes

      • querySave

        public java.lang.String querySave()
        This method will ask the player where to save their save file and what they would like to name it.
        Returns:
        the path of the file to be saved

      • saveSuccess

        public void saveSuccess()
        This method will tell the player that they have successfully saved the game.

      • queryLoad

        public java.lang.String queryLoad()
        This method will print a list of available load files and ask the player to select an available file to load.
        Returns:
        the path of the file to be loaded from

      • loadSuccess

        public void loadSuccess(boolean debug,
                        boolean hard,
                        boolean god)
        This method will tell the player that they have successfully loaded a save.
        Parameters:
        debug - true if the save is in debug mode, false otherwise
        hard - true if the save is in hard mode, false otherwise
        god - true if the save is in God mode, false otherwise

      • goodbye

        public void goodbye()
        This method prints a "goodbye" message to the player and quits the game safely.
